title.narrative: Data literacy in the IFRC Network

description.narrative: Currently a basic data playbook for national societies exists, and an e-learning on data for volunteers. Both have been developed in a collaboration between IFRC, NLRC-510 and American Red Cross. The current training package is however aimed at national societies in level 1 of the digital maturity (basic). Many of these training materials have been produced over the last years. 510 has trained over 20 national societies on various subjects related to data & digital, including strategic trainings on how to establish data teams. However, these materials need to be combined in a good curriculum that matches the maturity levels. Additionally, the content has to be agreed with IFRC, and translated in several languages.
NLRC-510 IFCR Intervention Team IFCR data literacy team American Red Cross

One of the key activities in the new IFRC Digital Strategy is to close the digital divide in the network, and to build the data literacy of all national societies. Together with the IFRC Intervention team we want to develop a training curriculum that helps national societies to move along the levels of maturity in the IFRC Digital Maturity model (levels 1-5).

The current training package is aimed at national societies in level 1 of the digital maturity (basic). 510 however is frequently requested to provide trainings to people in the national societies who already have good basic data skills, but need to improve their skills to deliver more advance data and digital support to their national society.
